title: Women's Rights National Historical Park: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials Thinking of bringing your class to Womenâ€™s Rights NHP for a field trip? We can help your class make better use of our museum exhibits during their visit. Download and print our scavenger hunts for elementary, middle, and high school levels. Contact us for answer sheets, and use the scavenger hunts to help assess your students visit to the park. All Curriculum Materials   Lesson Plans    Scavenger Hunts Available Learn More     Field Trips The park offers field trips for Elementary, Middle, and High School levels. They all explore the Wesleyan Chapel and the Elizabeth Cady Stanton House. All groups begin with a viewing of the park's orientation film "Dreams of Equality" and then view the park's exhibits and explore the First Wave Statue exhibit. For reservations, please contact us at 315-568-0024. All Field Trips   Field Trips    Field Trips Learn More
